Overcooked! is a singleplayer and multiplayer bird's-eye view action, party game, simulation and time management game in the Overcooked! series.

General information

GOG.com Community Discussions for game series
GOG.com Support Page
Steam Community Discussions

Availability[edit]

Source DRM Notes Keys OS
Amazon.co.uk
Epic Games Store
DRM-free when launched from the executable.[2]
GamersGate
GOG.com
Gourmet Edition
Green Man Gaming
Humble Store
Steam
Ubisoft Store
EA app (unavailable)
Gourmet Edition
No longer sold since June 13, 2022.[3]

Monetization[edit]

Type Notes
DLC The Lost Morsel DLC adds new content.
One-time game purchase The game requires an upfront purchase to access.

Microtransactions[edit]

Type Notes
No microtransactions Game does not contain any microtransactions.

DLC and expansion packs

Name Notes
The Lost Morsel Adds 6 new campaign levels and 6 new chef characters.

Game data[edit]

Configuration file(s) location[edit]

System Location
Windows HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Ghost Town Games\Overcooked\
Steam Play (Linux) <SteamLibrary-folder>/steamapps/compatdata/448510/pfx/[Note 2]

Save game data location[edit]

System Location
Windows %USERPROFILE%\AppData\LocalLow\Ghost Town Games\Overcooked\*.save
Steam Play (Linux) <SteamLibrary-folder>/steamapps/compatdata/448510/pfx/[Note 2]

Save game cloud syncing[edit]

System Native Notes
Epic Games Launcher
GOG Galaxy
EA app
Steam Cloud
Ubisoft Connect

Characters and camera movement is internally locked at 50 FPS.[4]

The game engine may allow for manual configuration of the game via its variables. See the Unity page for more details.

System requirements[edit]

Windows
Minimum
Operating system (OS) 7
Processor (CPU) Dual Core 2.4 GHz
System memory (RAM) 2 GB
Storage drive (HDD/SSD) 750 MB
Video card (GPU) Intel HD Graphics 4400
Nvidia GeForce 8800 GT
AMD Radeon HD 6850
DirectX 11 compatible


Notes

  1. ↑ Unity engine build: 5.5.0p1[1]
  2. ↑ 2.0 2.1 Notes regarding Steam Play (Linux) data:
    • File/folder structure within this directory reflects the path(s) listed for Windows and/or Steam game data.
    • Games with Steam Cloud support may also store data in ~/.steam/steam/userdata/<user-id>/448510/.
    • Use Wine's registry editor to access any Windows registry paths.
    • The app ID (448510) may differ in some cases.
    • Treat backslashes as forward slashes.
    • See the glossary page for details on Windows data paths.

  1. ↑ Verified by User:Baronsmoki on 2019-04-18
